wer is that a
factor is relevant when it is needed to justify the decision in the precedent.
These factors are often called the ratio decidendi—the reason for the decision.
Incorporating  the  doctrine  of  precedents  as  a  suppressed  premise,  the
argument from Yick Woto Plessycan now be reconstructed as follows:
(1) The ordinance in Yick Wowas declared unconstitutional.
(2) The ordinance in Yick Wois similar to the statute in Plessyin several
respects (A, B, C, D,and so on).
